required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating The Use Of Sirolimus In Recipients Of Kidney Allografts From Expanded Criteria Donors (ECD)
clinical_study.official_title: Surveillance Registry Of Sirolimus Use In Recipients Of Kidney Allograft From Expanded Criteria Donors (ECD)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this observational study is to examine the clinical outcomes of the use of sirolimus as base therapy in kidney allograft recipients from Expanded Criteria Donors (ECD) under conditions of routine clinical practice. The primary objective is to identify the current criteria/reasons to use sirolimus as base therapy in this selected population and define and understand the emerging patterns of immunosuppressive treatment with sirolimus.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Main Reason for the Use of Sirolimus (Rapamune) Therapy
primary_outcome.description: The study employ a questionnaire which included different clinical criteria to determine the main medical reason for the introduction of sirolimus (Rapamune) therapy after renal transplant. The physician responsible selected the one that was considered the main reason for introduction of sirolimus (Rapamune) as base immunosuppressive therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Probability of Graft Survival
secondary_outcome.description: Graft survival was considered in participants who did not experience graft failure. Graft failure was determined by return to dialysis for a period of at least 12 weeks with no return of function, or graft loss whichever occurred sooner.

secondary_outcome.measure: Probability of no Acute Rejection
secondary_outcome.description: Diagnosis of acute rejection was made via kidney biopsy. Categorization of biopsies with suspected acute rejection was based on histological findings using updated 1997 Banff criteria: Grade 1A: significant interstitial infiltration (greater than [>] 25 percent [%] of parenchyma affected) and foci of moderate tubulitis (5-10 cells/tubular cross section), Grade 1B: significant interstitial infiltration (>25% of parenchyma affected) and severe tubulitis (>10 mononuclear cells/tubular cross section), Grade 2A: mild-moderate intimal arteritis, Grade 2B: severe intimal arteritis comprising >25% of the luminal area and Grade 3: transmural arteritis and/or arterial fibrinoid change and necrosis of medial smooth muscle cells. Probability of no acute rejection throughout the sirolimus (Rapamune) therapy was estimated using Kaplan-Meier method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Probability of Participant Survival
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's survival defined as participant living with or without a functioning graft. Probability of participant survival throughout the sirolimus (Rapamune) therapy was estimated using Kaplan-Meier method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Dose of Immunosuppressive Drugs Administered
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1 or 2, 4 or 5, 12 or 13, 24 or 25, 52 or 53
secondary_outcome.description: Immunosuppressive drugs administered included cyclosporin A (CsA) administration based on monitoring of plasma trough levels (C0), CsA administration based on monitoring of plasma levels 2-hours after CsA dose (C2), tacrolimus, and sirolimus (Rapamune).

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Blood Level of Immunosuppressive Drugs Administered
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1 or 2, 4 or 5, 12 or 13, 24 or 25, 52 or 53
secondary_outcome.description: Immunosuppressive drugs administered included cyclosporin A (CsA) administration based on monitoring of plasma trough levels (C0), CsA administration based on monitoring of plasma levels 2-hours after CsA dose (C2), tacrolimus, and sirolimus (Rapamune).

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Creatinine Clearance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1 or 2, 4 or 5, 12 or 13, 24 or 25, 52 or 53
secondary_outcome.description: Creatinine clearance (CCr) is a measure of glomerular filtration rate (GMFR), an index of kidney function. CCr is the volume of blood plasma that is cleared of creatinine by the kidneys per unit time. Normal values for healthy, young males are in the range of 100-135 milliliter per minute (mL/min) and for females, 90-125 mL/min. Creatinine clearance decreases with age. A low creatinine clearance rate indicates poor kidney function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Proteinuria
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1 or 2, 4 or 5, 12 or 13, 24 or 25, 52 or 53
secondary_outcome.description: Proteinuria defined as the presence of an excess of serum proteins in the urine. Normal value of proteinuria is below 0.15 grams per 24 hours (g/24 hr).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Prematurely Discontinued the Sirolimus (Rapamune) Therapy
Percentage of Participants Who Prematurely Discontinued the Sirolimus (Rapamune) Therapy Due to Inefficacy
Percentage of Participants Who Prematurely Discontinued the Sirolimus (Rapamune) Therapy Due to Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to study drug in a participant who received study drug. A serious adverse event (SAE) was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Participants who discontinued sirolimus (Rapamune) therapy prematurely due to AE were obliged to discontinue sirolimus (Rapamune) therapy permanently, are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Body Mass Index
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1 or 2, 4 or 5, 12 or 13, 24 or 25, 52 or 53
secondary_outcome.description: BMI was calculated as weight divided by height squared and measured as kilogram per square meter (kg/m^2).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Body Temperature
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1 or 2, 4 or 5, 12 or 13, 24 or 25, 52 or 53
secondary_outcome.description: Body temperature was measured in degree Celsius. Each participants were classified into three different categories based on their body temperature: body temperature less than 35 degree Celsius = hypothermia, body temperature between 35 to 37.5 degree Celsius = feverless, and body temperature greater than 37.5 degree Celsius = fever.

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1 or 2, 4 or 5, 12 or 13, 24 or 25, 52 or 53
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic and diastolic blood pressure (BP) was measured after the participant had rested in the supine position for at least 5 minutes with the participant's arm supported at the level of the heart, and recorded to the nearest millimeters of mercury (mmHg).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pulse Rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1 or 2, 4 or 5, 12 or 13, 24 or 25, 52 or 53

secondary_outcome.measure: Body Weight
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1 or 2, 4 or 5, 12 or 13, 24 or 25, 52 or 53

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Physical Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: Physical abnormalities included all the abnormalities related to general disorders and administration site conditions, gastrointestinal disorders, skin and subcutaneous tissue disorders, vascular disorders, investigations, infections and infestations, eye disorders, respiratory, thoracic and mediastinal disorders, nervous system disorders, musculoskeletal and connective tissue disorders, injury, poisoning and procedural complications, surgical and medical procedures, psychiatric disorders, neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps), ear and labyrinth disorders, and congenital, familial and genetic disorders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to study drug in a participant who received study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Serious Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to study drug in a participant who received study drug. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Clinically-Significant Electrocardiogram Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: Standard 12-lead ECG was performed. ECG intervals included PR interval (time between the onset of atrial depolarization and the onset of ventricular depolarization), QRS interval (represented ventricular depolarization), QT interval (time corresponding to the beginning of depolarization to repolarization of the ventricles) corrected using Fridericia's formula (QTcF = QT divided by cube root of RR interval) and heart rate (time interval between consecutive heart beats [RR interval]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Clinically-Significant Radiological Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: Radiological examination was performed to evaluate presence or signs of infections or pneumonitis.

intervention.description: Non interventional. Sirolimus administered by Principal Investigator per standard practice and labeling.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 18 years or older.
- Patients who received a renal transplant (primary, secondary, tertiary, etc.) without pancreas, from Expanded Criteria Donors (ECD), 3 months prior and no later than 1 year at the time of study enrollment.
- Patients who provided informed consent.
- Patients without sirolimus as base therapy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are unwilling or unable to provide informed consent or who lack a legal guardian or designee able to provide consent on their behalf.
- Patients who are unable to complete the study.
- Patients who are participating in another clinical trial during the last 6 months.
- Pregnant or lactating patients.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Sirolimus
group.description: Participants who had kidney transplant from expanded criteria donors (ECD) and received sirolimus (Rapamune) as base therapy in immunosuppressive regimen according to the standard clinical practice as determined by the physician, were followed up for 1 year. The term ECD refers to kidneys from deceased donors who were either 60 years and older or aged 50 to 59 years with 2 of 3 conditions (serum creatinine level greater than [>] 1.5 milligram per deciliter [mg/dL], cerebrovascular accident as cause of death or history of hypertension).

baseline.population: Safety population included all participants who had received at least 1 dose of Rapamune and were subsequently interrogated.

outcome.title: Average Creatinine Clearance
outcome.description: Creatinine clearance (CCr) is a measure of glomerular filtration rate (GMFR), an index of kidney function. CCr is the volume of blood plasma that is cleared of creatinine by the kidneys per unit time. Normal values for healthy, young males are in the range of 100-135 milliliter per minute (mL/min) and for females, 90-125 mL/min. Creatinine clearance decreases with age. A low creatinine clearance rate indicates poor kidney function.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1 or 2, 4 or 5, 12 or 13, 24 or 25, 52 or 53
outcome.population: ITT population included all participants who were treated with Rapamune for at least 4 or 5 weeks. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies those participants who were evaluable for this measure. 'n' signifies those participants who were evaluable for this measure at given time points.

group.title: Sirolimus
group.description: Participants who had kidney transplant from expanded criteria donors (ECD) and received sirolimus (Rapamune) as base therapy in immunosuppressive regimen according to the standard clinical practice as determined by the physician, were followed up for 1 year. The term ECD refers to kidneys from deceased donors who were either 60 years and older or aged 50 to 59 years with 2 of 3 conditions (serum creatinine level greater than [>] 1.5 milligram per deciliter [mg/dL], cerebrovascular accident as cause of death or history of hypertension).

measure.title: Number of Participants With Body Temperature
measure.description: Body temperature was measured in degree Celsius. Each participants were classified into three different categories based on their body temperature: body temperature less than 35 degree Celsius = hypothermia, body temperature between 35 to 37.5 degree Celsius = feverless, and body temperature greater than 37.5 degree Celsius = fever.
measure.population: Safety population. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies those participants who were evaluable for this measure. 'n' signifies those participants who were evaluable for this measure at given time points. Results for hypothermia not reported as none of the participants was found hypothermic.

outcome.title: Blood Pressure
outcome.description: Systolic and diastolic blood pressure (BP) was measured after the participant had rested in the supine position for at least 5 minutes with the participants arm supported at the level of the heart, and recorded to the nearest millimeters of mercury (mmHg).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1 or 2, 4 or 5, 12 or 13, 24 or 25, 52 or 53
outcome.population: Safety population included all participants who had received at least 1 dose of Rapamune and were subsequently interrogated. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies those participants who were evaluable for this measure. 'n' signifies those participants who were evaluable for this measure at given time points.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Physical Abnormalities
outcome.description: Physical abnormalities included all the abnormalities related to general disorders and administration site conditions, gastrointestinal disorders, skin and subcutaneous tissue disorders, vascular disorders, investigations, infections and infestations, eye disorders, respiratory, thoracic and mediastinal disorders, nervous system disorders, musculoskeletal and connective tissue disorders, injury, poisoning and procedural complications, surgical and medical procedures, psychiatric disorders, neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps), ear and labyrinth disorders, and congenital, familial and genetic disorders.
outcome.population: Safety population included all participants who had received at least 1 dose of Rapamune and were subsequently interrogated.

group.title: Sirolimus
group.description: Participants who had kidney transplant from expanded criteria donors (ECD) and received sirolimus (Rapamune) as base therapy in immunosuppressive regimen according to the standard clinical practice as determined by the physician, were followed up for 1 year. The term ECD refers to kidneys from deceased donors who were either 60 years and older or aged 50 to 59 years with 2 of 3 conditions (serum creatinine level greater than [>] 1.5 milligram per deciliter [mg/dL], cerebrovascular accident as cause of death or history of hypertension).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Physical Abnormalities
measure.description: Physical abnormalities included all the abnormalities related to general disorders and administration site conditions, gastrointestinal disorders, skin and subcutaneous tissue disorders, vascular disorders, investigations, infections and infestations, eye disorders, respiratory, thoracic and mediastinal disorders, nervous system disorders, musculoskeletal and connective tissue disorders, injury, poisoning and procedural complications, surgical and medical procedures, psychiatric disorders, neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps), ear and labyrinth disorders, and congenital, familial and genetic disorders.
measure.population: Safety population included all participants who had received at least 1 dose of Rapamune and were subsequently interrogated.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events
outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to study drug in a participant who received study drug.
outcome.population: Safety population included all participants who had received at least 1 dose of Rapamune and were subsequently interrogated.

group.title: Sirolimus
group.description: Participants who had kidney transplant from expanded criteria donors (ECD) and received sirolimus (Rapamune) as base therapy in immunosuppressive regimen according to the standard clinical practice as determined by the physician, were followed up for 1 year. The term ECD refers to kidneys from deceased donors who were either 60 years and older or aged 50 to 59 years with 2 of 3 conditions (serum creatinine level greater than [>] 1.5 milligram per deciliter [mg/dL], cerebrovascular accident as cause of death or history of hypertension).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events
measure.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to study drug in a participant who received study drug.
measure.population: Safety population included all participants who had received at least 1 dose of Rapamune and were subsequently interrogated.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Serious Adverse Events
outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to study drug in a participant who received study drug. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly.
outcome.population: Safety population included all participants who had received at least 1 dose of Rapamune and were subsequently interrogated.

group.title: Sirolimus
group.description: Participants who had kidney transplant from expanded criteria donors (ECD) and received sirolimus (Rapamune) as base therapy in immunosuppressive regimen according to the standard clinical practice as determined by the physician, were followed up for 1 year. The term ECD refers to kidneys from deceased donors who were either 60 years and older or aged 50 to 59 years with 2 of 3 conditions (serum creatinine level greater than [>] 1.5 milligram per deciliter [mg/dL], cerebrovascular accident as cause of death or history of hypertension).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Serious Adverse Events
measure.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to study drug in a participant who received study drug. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly.
measure.population: Safety population included all participants who had received at least 1 dose of Rapamune and were subsequently interrogated.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Clinically-Significant Electrocardiogram Abnormalities
outcome.description: Standard 12-lead ECG was performed. ECG intervals included PR interval (time between the onset of atrial depolarization and the onset of ventricular depolarization), QRS interval (represented ventricular depolarization), QT interval (time corresponding to the beginning of depolarization to repolarization of the ventricles) corrected using Fridericia's formula (QTcF = QT divided by cube root of RR interval) and heart rate (time interval between consecutive heart beats [RR interval]).
outcome.population: Safety population included all participants who had received at least 1 dose of Rapamune and were subsequently interrogated.

group.title: Sirolimus
group.description: Participants who had kidney transplant from expanded criteria donors (ECD) and received sirolimus (Rapamune) as base therapy in immunosuppressive regimen according to the standard clinical practice as determined by the physician, were followed up for 1 year. The term ECD refers to kidneys from deceased donors who were either 60 years and older or aged 50 to 59 years with 2 of 3 conditions (serum creatinine level greater than [>] 1.5 milligram per deciliter [mg/dL], cerebrovascular accident as cause of death or history of hypertension).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Clinically-Significant Electrocardiogram Abnormalities
measure.description: Standard 12-lead ECG was performed. ECG intervals included PR interval (time between the onset of atrial depolarization and the onset of ventricular depolarization), QRS interval (represented ventricular depolarization), QT interval (time corresponding to the beginning of depolarization to repolarization of the ventricles) corrected using Fridericia's formula (QTcF = QT divided by cube root of RR interval) and heart rate (time interval between consecutive heart beats [RR interval]).
measure.population: Safety population included all participants who had received at least 1 dose of Rapamune and were subsequently interrogated.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Clinically-Significant Radiological Abnormalities
outcome.description: Radiological examination was performed to evaluate presence or signs of infections or pneumonitis.
outcome.population: Safety population included all participants who had received at least 1 dose of Rapamune and were subsequently interrogated.

measure.description: Radiological examination was performed to evaluate presence or signs of infections or pneumonitis.
measure.population: Safety population included all participants who had received at least 1 dose of Rapamune and were subsequently interrogated.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Sirolimus
group.description: Participants who had kidney transplant from expanded criteria donors (ECD) and received sirolimus (Rapamune) as base therapy in immunosuppressive regimen according to the standard clinical practice as determined by the physician, were followed up for 1 year. The term ECD refers to kidneys from deceased donors who were either 60 years and older or aged 50 to 59 years with 2 of 3 conditions (serum creatinine level greater than [>] 1.5 milligram per deciliter [mg/dL], cerebrovascular accident as cause of death or history of hypertension).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
